Container¶

Container reference¶

class repairbox.container.BugContainer¶
alive¶

Indicates whether or not the container is still running.

bug¶

The bug inside this container.

container¶

The Docker container underlying this object.

interact() → None¶

Connects to the PTY (pseudo-TTY) for this container. Blocks until the user exits the PTY. Does not handle destruction of the container; user should call destroy once finished with the container.

destroy() → None¶

Deallocates all resources associated with this container. If this container has already been destroyed, this method quietly returns (i.e., no errors are thrown).

reset() → None¶

Resets the state of this container.

patch()¶

Apply a patch to the source code.

spectra() → repairbox.spectra.Spectra¶

Computes and returns the spectra for this bug.

copy_to(source_fn: str, dest_fn: str) → None¶

Copies a given file from the host machine to a specified location inside this container.

execute_command(cmd, context='/', stdout=True, stderr=False, block=True)¶

Returns a tuple containing the exit code, execution duration, and output, respectively.

compile(mode='default', verbose=True)¶

Attempts to compile the program inside this container.

TODO: check for failure

execute(test)¶

Executes a given test inside this container and returns the result of that execution.
